cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 210 miles SE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest toward the northern Yucatan today, then forecast to turn north-northeast over the central Gulf and reach the northern Gulf Coast (southeast LA–MS) late Wednesday

weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm warnings confined to the Yucatán Peninsula of Mexico
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greatest impact zone expected from southeast Louisiana eastward to coastal Mississippi/Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Low probability (≤4%) of experiencing tropical-storm-force winds; any gusts that reach the port would likely stay below 39 mph.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None anticipated given the forecast track east of the upper Texas coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring 1–2 inches of rain late Wednesday into early Thursday, but widespread flooding is not expected.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated thunderstorms in outer bands may cause short-lived lightning or brief squalls, but significant operational disruption is unlikely.
